uno

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • uno.Player

  • public class Player
extends java.lang.Object
    This class models player objects that resemble the four players in the uno game, and their hands of cards.
    Author:
    Derek Syrba, John Frocillo, and Adrian Harrell

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      UnoCards getCurrentCard()
      A getter method to return the player's current card they are looking at.
      boolean getIsPlayerTurn()
      A getter method that returns the boolean value indicating if it is the player's turn.
      java.util.ArrayList<UnoCards> getPlayerDeck()
      A getter method to return the player's hand.
      void setCurrentCard(UnoCards card)
      A setter method to set the player's current card to a new UnoCards object.
      void setIsPlayerTurn(boolean turn)
      A setter method to set the player's turn to true or false.
      void setPlayerDeck(java.util.ArrayList<UnoCards> deck)
      A setter method to set the player's hand to an arraylist of cards.

        public boolean getIsPlayerTurn()
        A getter method that returns the boolean value indicating if it is the player's turn.
